title: Adding Logos
text: order add logo create plot, save , use add_logo(). function takes six arguments: plot_path: url local file plot logo_path: url, local file plot one built logos. logo_position: Optional argument. Can ‘top left’, ‘top right’, ‘bottom left’, ‘bottom right’. per Brookings style guide, default logo position ‘bottom right’. logo_scale: Optional argument. portion plot width logo occupy. default 5 means logo 1/5th plot width. height_padding: Optional argument. Control y axis position logo specifying padding proportion. Default 4.5% padding. width_padding: Optional argument. Control x axis position logo specifying padding proportion. Default 1% padding. Currently, available built logos : information function works, please read Tom Mock’s fantastic blog post add logo plot. ggbrookings::add_logo() builds function described article minor modifications.

title: Adding Logos
text: start creating plot using ggsave() save . Finally, add logo call:  image show Viewer pane. save png can right click select “Save Image …” , reproducibly, assign object call magick::image_write() :
code: librarian::shelf(ggplot2, ggbrookings, palmerpenguins, magick) theme_set(theme_brookings())  p1 <-   ggplot(data = penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm)) +   geom_histogram(aes(fill = species),                  alpha = 0.5,                  position = "identity",                  bins = 30) +   scale_fill_brookings(palette = "semantic3") +   labs(x = "Flipper length (mm)",        y = "Frequency",        title = "Penguin flipper lengths",        caption = '**Source:** Palmer Penguins',        tag = 'FIGURE 1') +   scale_x_continuous(expand = expansion()) +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion())  ggsave("penguins.png", p1, dpi=300, height=3.7, width=6, units="in") add_logo('penguins.png', logo_path = 'brookings', 'bottom right', 5) penguins_plot <- add_logo('penguins.png', logo_path = 'brookings', 'bottom right', 5)  image_write(penguins_plot, "penguins.png")

title: Grammar of Graphics in Brookings Style
text: order match Brookings style scatterplots set geom_point(size = 2) :
code: ggplot(data = penguins,        aes(x = bill_length_mm,            y = bill_depth_mm,            group = species)) +   geom_point(aes(color = species,                  shape = species),              size = 2,              alpha = 0.8) +   geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, aes(color = species)) +   theme_brookings() +   scale_color_brookings(palette = "misc") +   labs(title = "Penguin bill dimensions",        subtitle = "Bill length and depth for Adelie, Chinstrap and Gentoo Penguins at Palmer Station LTER",        caption = '**Source:** Palmer Penguins',        tag = 'FIGURE 1',        x = "Bill length (mm)",        y = "Bill depth (mm)",        color = "Penguin species",        shape = "Penguin species")

code: librarian::shelf(gapminder)  gapminder_filtered <-   gapminder %>%    filter(country %in% c('Argentina', 'Brazil', 'Uruguay'))    gapminder_filtered %>%    ggplot(aes(x = year, gdpPercap, color = country, label = country)) +   geom_line(size = 1.5) +   geom_label(data = gapminder_filtered %>% filter(year == last(year)),               aes(label = country,                   x = year + 3,                   y = gdpPercap + 250,                   color = country)) +   theme_brookings(base_size = 16) +   guides(color = 'none') +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1952, 2007, 5),                      limits  = c(1952, 2012),                      expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.1))) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_dollar(),                       limits = c(0, 15000), breaks = seq(0, 15000, 2500),                      expand = expansion(0)) +   scale_color_brookings() +   labs(title = 'Economic growth in South America',        subtitle = 'GDP per capita, 1952-2007',        caption = '**Source:** Gapminder',        tag = 'FIGURE 4',        x = NULL,         y = NULL)
